Package org.proto4j.graph

Proto4j-JBracket

A small and simple Swing-Component to create dynamic tournament bracket views. A view usually consists of the following main components:

  • BracketModel: data model
  • BracketCellRenderer: cell renderer
  • BracketLinePainter: line painter
These components must be provided to use the JBracketView correctly. By default, the view can be created as follows: 
 
     JBracketView<T> view = new JBracketView<>(new DefaultBracketModel<>());
     view.setLinePainter(new DefaultBracketLinePainter());

     // to use the view in a JScrollPane, just add it to its viewport
     JScrollPane scrollPane = new JScrollPane(view);
Whereby the T can be replaced by any element type that should be stored. At least the BracketCellRenderer should support displaying the elements' type.
See Also:
JBracketView
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BracketCellRenderer<E>
    Identifies components that can be used as "rubber stamps" to paint the cells in a JBracketView.
    BracketLinePainter
    Classes implementing this interface are used to draw the lines between different brackets.
    BracketLocator
    Manages the computing of each bracket position in the JBracketView container.
    BracketModel<T>
    Simple model to manage all bracket components.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BracketConstraints
    The BracketConstraints class specifies constraints either for the BracketLocator or BracketLinePainter to use when painting the parent JBracketView.
    BracketUtil
    Small collection of methods to simplify the painting of lines in a JBracketView.
    DefaultBracketLinePainter
    Default implementation of a simple BracketLinePainter.
    DefaultBracketModel<E>
    Default BracketModel that used a LinkedList to store all columns.
    DefaultBracketModel.Column<E>
    Small wrapper class for a synchronized ArrayList.
    JBracketView<T>
    A JBracketView is used to display two-dimensional tables of cells, whereby each column can have a variable amount of rows.
